docblock.description: Handles setting root relative URLs.
WordPress likes to use absolute URLs on everything - let's clean that up.

docblock.description: Handles URL rewrites.
URL rewriting
docblock.long-description:
Rewrites do not happen for multisite installations or child themes
Rewrite: /wp-content/themes/themename/assets/css/ to /assets/css/ /wp-content/themes/themename/assets/js/ to /assets/js/ /wp-content/themes/themename/assets/img/ to /assets/img/ /wp-content/plugins/ to /plugins/
If you aren't using Apache, alternate configuration settings can be found in the docs.

tag.name: return
tag.description: WordPress rewrite object with added rewrites.

docblock.long-description: You should do your best not to overwrite any method and to use the custom_[some_property] properties for configuring the base class methods which have parameters. Feel free to over write any of the parameters you see fit to make the sub-classes more versatile. As with every rule there is in exception do not overwrite $meta_helper unless you know what you are doing...which if your over writing it you probably do not. Make sure to include the parameters marked as REQUIRED or else the class will not work at all everything has sensible defaults.

docblock.description: Retrieves custom post meta.
docblock.long-description: global $my_post_type; // Retrieves all the current posts meta. $all_post_meta = $my_post_type->get_post_meta(); extract( $all_post_meta ); // Retrieves a single post meta value. $single_post_meta = $my_post_type->get_post_meta( get_the_id(), 'meta_key'); extract( $single_post_meta );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional post id, defaults to current post.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional meta key minus the post type, to return one meta value instead of all of them.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Specific post meta value | All all post meta values.

docblock.description: Override this method to create custom meta fields.
docblock.long-description: By returning an empty array in this method, we're telling the class to not to do anything will custom meta (e.g. meta boxes, and saving meta etc...) The overridden method should return an array like.. return array( array( 'label' => 'Title/Position', 'desc' => '', 'id' => $prefix.'Title', 'type' => 'text', ), array( 'label' => 'Quote', 'desc' => '', 'id' => $prefix.'Quote', 'type' => 'textarea', ) );

MDG Images Class.
Handles adding custom image sizes and other global image related functionality.
The available image sizes.
Class constructor
Sets all of the custom image sizes
docblock.long-description: $this->image_sizes['example_size'] = array( 'width' => 220, 'height' => 130, 'title' => '220x130', // The default will be widthxheight but any string can be used 'used_in' => array( 'title' => 'Example Size', // Title to be used in Media notification 'link' => '' // Link to an image of the created size to be used in Media notification ) );

docblock.description: Sets the image sizes for the responsive images plugin.
docblock.long-description: set_responsive_image_sizes( 500, 200, 'some_image', array( 'med' => 200 ), 'Used in some image spot' )

tag.name: param
tag.description: Image largest/original width, this will be the 'full' size title.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The title that will be prepended to the image size title.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Title to be used in Media notification

tag.name: type
tag.description: string $title Size title. => @type integer $width Image width. }

Feel free to over write any of the parameters you see fit to make the sub-classes more versatile. As with every rule there is in exception do not overwrite $meta_helper unless you know what you are doing...which if your over writing it you probably do not. Make sure to include the parameters marked as REQUIRED or else the class will not work at all everything has sensible defaults.

docblock.long-description: This file works really well as a scratch pad when trying something new. Unless you have a really good reason this file should not be used.

docblock.description: MDG Type Post Class.
Handles anything custom for the default WordPress "post" post type.
docblock.long-description: You should do your best not to overwrite any method and to use the custom_[some_property] properties for configuring the base class methods which have parameters. Feel free to over write any of the parameters you see fit to make the sub-classes more versatile. As with every rule there is in exception do not overwrite $meta_helper unless you know what you are doing...which if your over writing it you probably do not. Make sure to include the parameters marked as REQUIRED or else the class will not work at all everything has sensible defaults.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Arguments to be used when registering the post type's taxonomy

tag.name: var
tag.description: Arguments to be used when registering the post type

tag.name: var
tag.description: All of the transients for each post type, post type will be used as key.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The post types custom labels used in register_post_type()

tag.name: var
tag.description: Used to disable the addition of the featured image column

tag.name: var
tag.description: Custom post type arguments used in register_post_type()

tag.name: var
tag.description: Custom post type supports array used in register_post_type()

Class Constructor
Sets all of the classes parameters
This method runs after __construct() just a way for sub classes to run custom initialization stuff while still inheriting the constructor from this class
Actions that need to be set for this base class only using add_action() sub-classes will need to set there own actions without overriding this method

docblock.description: Retrieves the responsive image.
docblock.long-description: Requires responsive images plugin to be activated in Grunt uglify config. get_responsive_image( get_the_id(), 'some_image', null, true, array( 'title' => 'My title image' ) ); ?>

tag.name: param
tag.description: The attachment ID or the post ID to get the featured image from.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The base title of your responsive image size set in MDG_Images->set_image_sizes().

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional, default image URL, defaults to the 'full' size image, used if Javascript is not supported.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional, to output the responsive image, default true.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional, HTML attributes to add to the img tag.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The responsive image HTML with no script fall back.

Will cycle through your fields array, and create your form

docblock.description: Retrieves custom post meta.
docblock.long-description: global $my_post_type; // Retrieves all the current posts meta. $all_post_meta = $my_post_type->get_post_meta(); extract( $all_post_meta ); // Retrieves a single post meta value. $single_post_meta = $my_post_type->get_post_meta( get_the_id(), 'meta_key'); extract( $single_post_meta );

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional post id, defaults to current post.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional meta key minus the post type, to return one meta value instead of all of them.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Specific post meta value | All all post meta values.

docblock.description: Override this method to create custom meta fields.
docblock.long-description: By returning an empty array in this method, we're telling the class to not to do anything will custom meta (e.g. meta boxes, and saving meta etc...) The overridden method should return an array like.. return array( array( 'label' => 'Title/Position', 'desc' => '', 'id' => $prefix.'Title', 'type' => 'text', ), array( 'label' => 'Quote', 'desc' => '', 'id' => $prefix.'Quote', 'type' => 'textarea', ) );

docblock.description: Handles registering and generating the custom meta box.
Handles outputting of the meta box form.
Handles the saving of custom meta.

tag.description: ID of the post that you wish to save custom meta for

docblock.description: Traverse elements to create list from elements.
docblock.long-description:
Display one element if the element doesn't have any children otherwise, display the element and its children. Will only traverse up to the max depth and no ignore elements under that depth. It is possible to set the max depth to include all depths, see walk() method.
This method should not be called directly, use the walk() method instead.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Passed by reference. Used to append additional content.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Null on failure with no changes to parameters.

docblock.description: Sidebar/Widgets.
Determines whether or not to display the sidebar based on an array of conditional tags or page templates.
docblock.long-description: If any of the is_* conditional tags or is_page_template(template_file) checks return true, the sidebar will NOT be displayed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: list of page templates. These will be checked via is_page_template()

tag.name: return
tag.description: True will display the sidebar, False will not
